unnormalised: EduTech Buzz: Are Virtual Classrooms the New "Normal"?
normalised: EduTech Buzz: Are Virtual Classrooms the New "Normal"?

unnormalised: Hey folks! Things are heating up in the education sector, and it's not just because exam season is around the corner! Virtual classrooms are becoming seriously popular, especially after the pandemic. Think BYJU's and Vedantu, but scaled up.
normalised: Hey folks! Things are heating up in the education sector, and it's not just because exam season is around the corner! Virtual classrooms are becoming seriously popular, especially after the pandemic. Think B Y J U's and Vedantu, but scaled up.

unnormalised: Remember those days huddled around a single textbook? Now, kids in Guwahati can learn complex physics from a teacher in Chennai, all from their laptops. Pretty cool, huh?
normalised: Remember those days huddled around a single textbook? Now, kids in Guwahati can learn complex physics from a teacher in Chennai, all from their laptops. Pretty cool, huh?

unnormalised: Many schools in Kerala are even incorporating virtual sessions to supplement traditional learning, especially around Onam holidays, making sure studies don't take a backseat amidst the festivities.
normalised: Many schools in Kerala are even incorporating virtual sessions to supplement traditional learning, especially around Onam holidays, making sure studies don't take a backseat amidst the festivities.

unnormalised: It's not all smooth sailing though - reliable internet access is still a challenge in many rural areas. But the potential to reach students everywhere, offering personalized learning experiences, is HUGE.
normalised: It's not all smooth sailing though dash reliable internet access is still a challenge in many rural areas. But the potential to reach students everywhere, offering personalized learning experiences, is huge.

unnormalised: Imagine interactive lessons, AI-powered tutoring, and learning while munching on some delicious biryani (during breaks, of course!). The future of learning is definitely looking digital, and India is right in the middle of the revolution. What do you think? Let us know in the comments!
normalised: Imagine interactive lessons, A I powered tutoring, and learning while munching on some delicious biryani (during breaks, of course!). The future of learning is definitely looking digital, and India is right in the middle of the revolution. What do you think? Let us know in the comments!
